private_information: I can directly manipulate blocks A, C, G, H
I can pick up and put down one block at a time
robot1.goal: Collaborate to reach the final configuration: A on G; B on D; C on B; D on table; E on table; F on E; G on F; H on table.

private_information: I can directly manipulate blocks B, D, E, F
I can pick up and put down one block at a time
robot2.goal: Collaborate to reach the final configuration: A on G; B on D; C on B; D on table; E on table; F on E; G on F; H on table.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' observations and produce a PDDL domain and problem (compatible with FastDownwards) that capture the initial state and the final arrangement of the blocks after the provided action sequence.

public_information: Blocks: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H.
Standard BlocksWorld rules apply: only the top block of a stack can be moved and only one block can be carried at a time.
Initial configuration: A is on G; B is on D; C is on H; D is on the table; E is on the table; F is on E; G is on F; H is on the table.
Action sequence executed in order: 1. unstack(C, H) 2. stack(C, B) 3. unstack(A, G) 4. putdown(A) 5. pickup(A) 6. stack(A, C) 7. pickup(H) 8. putdown(H) 9. unstack(A, C) 10. stack(A, G)
Final configuration after the sequence: A is on G; B is on D; C is on B; D is on the table; E is on the table; F is on E; G is on F; H is on the table.

plan.system_prompt: You are a blocks manipulation agent. Provide a clear natural-language account of the actions you will perform or observe given public and private information. Do not emit PDDL.
plan.prompt: Your name is robot1. Use the public information: {environment->public_information} and your private information: {agents->robot1->private_information}. Your objective is: {agents->robot1->goal}. Provide a step-by-step natural-language description of the moves you will perform or monitor to help achieve the goal, and note any assumptions or limitations you have.

plan.system_prompt: You are a blocks manipulation agent. Provide a clear natural-language account of the actions you will perform or observe given public and private information. Do not emit PDDL.
plan.prompt: Your name is robot2. Use the public information: {environment->public_information} and your private information: {agents->robot2->private_information}. Your objective is: {agents->robot2->goal}. Provide a step-by-step natural-language description of the moves you will perform or monitor to help achieve the goal, and note any assumptions or limitations you have.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent BlocksWorld modeling and in creating PDDL domain and problem files compatible with the FastDownwards planner. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that model the BlocksWorld initial state and the final arrangement after the given action sequence. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. If multiple agents' inputs conflict or are partial, reconcile them and keep actions distinct where relevant.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the agents' natural-language plans {plan_robot1} and {plan_robot2} together with the public information {environment->public_information}. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards. The PDDL problem must represent the initial state and the final arrangement of blocks after the action sequence. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem>.
